edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.core.datastructures.textannotation

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.cs.cogcomp.core.datastructures.textannotation.View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IQueryable<Constituent>, Serializable, Iterable<Constituent>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoreferenceView, PredicateArgumentView, SpanLabelView, TreeView

    public class View
extends Object
implements Serializable, IQueryable<Constituent>
    This class represents a view of the text. According to the multi-view architecture, any annotation on text can be thought of as a graph, where each node in the graph may correspond to sets of tokens in the text. Labeled directed edges between the nodes denote relations.

    The nodes are objects of type Constituent and the edges are objects of type Relation.

    This class represents a generic view without any restrictions on the structure of the graph and can be used for general purpose application specific views. However, for most standard annotations can be represented as one of the sub-classes of this class.

    Author:
    Vivek Srikumar
    See Also:
    Constituent, Relation, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected QueryableList<Constituent> constituents
      The collection of constituents
      protected int endSpan
      The token id of the token next to the rightmost token in this view.
      protected QueryableList<Relation> relations
      The collection of relations in this view.
      protected double score
      The score of this view, which is generated by the system that annotates this view.
      protected int startSpan
      The token id of the leftmost token in this view.
      protected TextAnnotation textAnnotation
      The TextAnnotation that is annotated by this view.
      protected ArrayList[] tokensToConstituents
      A inverted index from token ids to constituents in this view that cover that token.
      protected String viewGenerator
      The name of the system that generates this view.
      protected String viewName
      The name of this view.

    • Field Detail

      • viewName

        protected final String viewName
        The name of this view. While this can be any arbitrary string, if the view represents a standard annotation, use one of the standard names from ViewNames.

      • score

        protected final double score
        The score of this view, which is generated by the system that annotates this view.

      • textAnnotation

        protected final TextAnnotation textAnnotation
        The TextAnnotation that is annotated by this view.

      • constituents

        protected final QueryableList<Constituent> constituents
        The collection of constituents

      • relations

        protected final QueryableList<Relation> relations
        The collection of relations in this view.

      • startSpan

        protected int startSpan
        The token id of the leftmost token in this view.

      • endSpan

        protected int endSpan
        The token id of the token next to the rightmost token in this view.

      • viewGenerator

        protected final String viewGenerator
        The name of the system that generates this view.

      • tokensToConstituents

        protected final ArrayList[] tokensToConstituents
        A inverted index from token ids to constituents in this view that cover that token.

        The first element corresponds to the token id, the second corresponds to the constituent .

            TextAnnotation text,

        Parameters:
        viewName - The name of this view
        viewGenerator - The source of this view
        text - The text annotation that this view annotates
        score - The score of this view

      • addConstituent

      • removeConstituent

        public void removeConstituent(Constituent constituent)
        Removes a constituent from this view

      • addRelation

        public void addRelation(Relation relation)
        Adds a new relation to this view. This function throws an exception if the relation involves constituents that are not contained in this view. In order for a relation to be added, the constituents should have been added first. This function does not check for this.
        Parameters:
        relation - The relation to be added

      • removeRelation

        public void removeRelation(Relation relation)
        removes a relation from this view.
